author: Unreal Engine
description:
Check out the updates to Unreal Engine’s in-editor animation toolsets in UE 5.6. 

UE 5.6 enables you to animate with greater speed, precision, and control, bringing significant improvements to Sequencer, the Curve Editor, Tween Tools, Motion Trails, and more.

Watch this video for a walkthrough of the new animation functionality in UE 5.6, and find out how this release enables you to do even more animating directly in Unreal Engine, slashing the time-consuming need to roundtrip with DCCs. 

Learn more about Unreal Engine 5.6 here: unrealengine.com/news/unreal-engine-5-6-is-now-available

#Animation, #UnrealEngine5.6, #Sequencer, #CurveEditor, #TweenTools, #MotionTrails
title: A First Look at the New Animation Features in Unreal Engine 5.6

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Setting up content for physics can be difficult and time consuming. In this session, we explore how UE5’s Dataflow Graph system can alleviate that pain.

The Dataflow Graph system provides a non-destructive node-based workflow to set up a variety of Chaos Physics assets, including Destruction, Cloth, Flesh, and Groom.

The talk teaches you how to take advantage of Dataflow to speed up iteration time and enhance the quality of your Chaos Physics assets. You’ll also gain an understanding of how to automate your workflows to process multiple assets from a single Dataflow graph.
title: Non-Destructive Workflows for Chaos Physics in UE5 | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
This session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali dives into the art principles of ‘Fortnite: Battle Royale’ through the lens of a lighting art director. 

We dig into conceptual principles that make up a compelling scene, then show how these concepts can be used in approaches to world lighting, biome-specific lighting adjustments, and considerations around scaling lighting across platforms.

We also take you through the Day Sequence plugin—a collection of actors and assets that you can use to automatically generate a 24-hour day cycle. These components make it simpler to set up a time of day system while having more artistic control over the sun, moon, stars, and atmosphere. We demonstrate how you can use the Day Sequence plugin to create visually compelling differences in Fortnite islands.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#FortniteBattleRoyale, #DaySequencePlugin, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: The Artistic and Technical Approach to Lighting in Fortnite: Battle Royale | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
This session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali focuses on creating high-quality hairstyles for MetaHumans using an efficient and intuitive grooming workflow.  

Learn how to build complex styles with streamlined tools and export groom data with the proper attributes for seamless integration into Unreal Engine.  The session also covers best practices for preparing grooms for the Fab marketplace.

Learn more about the MetaHuman framework here: metahuman.com

#Grooms, #MetaHuman, #DigitalHumans, #MetaHumanCreator, #UnrealFestBali
title: How to Create Grooms for MetaHumans | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In January 2025, the Epic Games Store’s ‘on mobile update’ added support for third-party mobile games along with several new features, and launched the Free Games Program, starting the journey as one of the first true multiplatform stores covering PC, Mac, Android, and iOS.  

In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali, the EGS team covers the vision,  strategy, and roadmap across PC and mobile for the upcoming year.

Learn more about the Epic Games Store here: store.epicgames.com/distribution

#FreeGamesProgram, #EpicGamesStore, #UnrealFestOrlando
title: Epic Games Store: 2025 Update | Unreal Fest Bali 2025
